HtmlDates Module¶

class epyk.core.html.HtmlDates.CountDownDate(report, yyyy_mm_dd, label, icon, timeInMilliSeconds, width, height, htmlCode, helper, profile)¶
class epyk.core.html.HtmlDates.DatePicker(report, value, label, icon, color, htmlCode, profile, options, helper)¶
add_options(options=None, name=None, value=None)¶

Add TimePicker options

Related Pages:

https://timepicker.co/options/

Parameters

  • key – A string or a Python dictionary with the options to set

  • val – Optional.

excluded_dates(dts=None, jsFncs=None)¶
Parameters

  • dts –

  • jsFncs –

included_dates(dts=None, jsFncs=None)¶
Parameters

  • dts –

  • jsFncs –

property options¶

The progress bar is designed to display the current percent complete for a process. The bar is coded to be flexibly sized through CSS and will scale to fit inside its parent container by default.

Related Pages:

https://api.jqueryui.com/menu

Return type

OptInputs.OptionsDatePicker

class epyk.core.html.HtmlDates.LastUpdated(report, label, color, width, height, htmlCode, profile)¶
class epyk.core.html.HtmlDates.TimePicker(report, value, label, icon, color, htmlCode, profile, options, helper)¶
change(jsFnc)¶

Event triggerd when the value of the input field changes. A Date object containing the selected time is passed as the first argument of the callback. Note: the variable time is a function parameter received in the Javascript side

Usage:

morning = rptObj.ui.fields.time("8:13:00", label="Time field")
morning.change([

rptObj.js.alert(“time”, skip_data_convert=True)

])

Related Pages:

https://timepicker.co/options/

Parameters

jsFnc –

property options¶

The progress bar is designed to display the current percent complete for a process. The bar is coded to be flexibly sized through CSS and will scale to fit inside its parent container by default.

Related Pages:

https://api.jqueryui.com/menu

Return type

OptInputs.OptionsTimePicker
